bug.short_desc: Add service outage banner at top of webapp pages

long_desc.thetext:
It would be really good to get a configurable banner near the top of all web pages so that we can notify users of an outage or other service disruption in advance.
Something like this...
OpenGrok ----------------------------------------------------------------- /--------------------------------------------------------------\ | Due to a site power outage opengrok will be unavailable | | Between 9:00 and 5:30 Friday 2nd April 2008 | \--------------------------------------------------------------/
Full Search ( ) Definition ( ) Symbol ( ) ....
Is there a good reason for not putting this information in the pageheader.jspf file?
Please reopen the bug if there is a good reason for not using pageheader.jspf for this.

this would be needed for smf indexer to be able to give heads up about ongoing indexing
the file should also be e.g. in index directory and not part of webapp itself
Taking over this one. Initially this will be done using DATA_ROOT/header_include config file which is appended to pageheader.jspf.

pushed:

Needs some verification.

reviewed by Lubos Kosco :)
Fix integrated (apologies for the brokeness in the process, this was my first OpenGrok push).

(In reply to comment #0) > It would be really good to get a configurable banner near the top of all web > pages so that we can notify users of an outage or other service disruption in > advance. > > Something like this... > > OpenGrok > ----------------------------------------------------------------- > /--------------------------------------------------------------\ > | Due to a site power outage opengrok will be unavailable | > | Between 9:00 and 5:30 Friday 2nd April 2008 | > \--------------------------------------------------------------/ > > Full Search ( ) > Definition ( ) > Symbol ( ) > ....
The final version will have the banner placeable next to the OpenGrok logo, like this:
OpenGrok arbitrary-HTML-code-here... ... Full Search ( ) Definition ( ) Symbol ( ) ....
Also see the attached screenshot.
Created attachment 4616 screenshot of page with sample banner
